overview_of_class:
This course surveys the history of the United States since the end of the Civil War, a period of rapid, often wrenching social, material, and cultural change, the fault lines of which still shape American politics and the United States' relations with the rest of the world. Students will consider the major events and themes of the period, from Reconstruction to the aftermath of 9/11; weigh different scholarly and political explanations of those events; and fashion original arguments rooted in the critical


analysis of primary documents.
name: History of the United States, Reconstruction to the Present
subject: HISTORY
